text:
Hi All,

We faced the issue with superscripts. It seems that when calculating superscript baseline position the fo:blocks font-size is taken into account. As a result a cannot use different font-sizes in one paragraph when working with superscripts.
Subscripts are calculated correctly - based on fo:inline font-size.

Can anyone comment if this behavior is by design or is it a bug?

Sample is attached.

Kind Regards,
Alexander

not a bug; baseline shift is defined in terms of the font size of the parent area, which in your examples is the block, and not the contained inlines; you can fix your content by introducing a container inline inside the block that contains the word with the superscript/subscript; see XSL-FO 1.1 Section 7.14 for further information
